intro: Geruma alba, commonly known as the white geruma, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Its bark and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Geruma alba is valued not only for its ornamental appeal but also for its ecological role in supporting local biodiversity.
